Seed.Tag2: PlantPart. chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of alstonia scholaris (l.) r. br has yielded mixtures of erythrodiol , uvaol , and betulin in a 1:1:1 ratio, oleanolic acid and ursolic acid in a 2:1 ratio, beta-amyrin acetate and alpha-amyrin acetate in a 1:4 ratio, and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in a 3:2 ratio; squalene , beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters , and chlorophyll a. isolation of the chemical constituents from the leaves of alstonia scholaris the air-dried alstonia scholaris leaves (113.21 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for 3 days and then filtered. silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of alstonia scholaris yielded squalene, beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, chlorophyll a, . the nmr spectra of erythrodiol, are in accordance with data reported in the literature for erythrodiol ; uvaol, for uvaol ; betulin, for betulin ; oleanolic acid, for oleanolic acid ; 2a):ursolic acid, for ursolic acid ; 3a for beta-amyrin acetate ; 3a):alpha-amyrin acetate, for alpha-amyrin acetate ; beta-sitosterol, for beta-sitosterol ; stigmasterol, for stigmasterol ; squalene, for squalene ; beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, for beta-sitosteryl-3betaglucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters ; and chlorophyll a, for chlorophyll a

Relation.Pattern: . chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of alstonia scholaris (l.) r. br has yielded mixtures of erythrodiol , uvaol , and betulin in a 1:1:1 ratio, oleanolic acid and ursolic acid in a 2:1 ratio, beta-amyrin acetate and alpha-amyrin acetate in a 1:4 ratio, and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in a 3:2 ratio; squalene , beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters , and chlorophyll a.

isolation of the chemical constituents from the leaves of alstonia scholaris the air-dried alstonia scholaris leaves (113.21 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for 3 days and then filtered.

silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of alstonia scholaris yielded squalene, beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, chlorophyll a, . the nmr spectra of erythrodiol, are in accordance with data reported in the literature for erythrodiol ; uvaol, for uvaol ; betulin, for betulin ; oleanolic acid, for oleanolic acid ; 2a):ursolic acid, for ursolic acid ; 3a for beta-amyrin acetate ; 3a):alpha-amyrin acetate, for alpha-amyrin acetate ; beta-sitosterol, for beta-sitosterol ; stigmasterol, for stigmasterol ; squalene, for squalene ; beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, for beta-sitosteryl-3betaglucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters ; and chlorophyll a, for chlorophyll a

the ethanolic extract of the flowers of alstonia scholaris afforded alstoprenyol, 3-beta-hydroxy-28-beta-acetoxy-5-olea, alstoprenylene 3beta-acetate-24-nor-urs-4,12,2'-triene ester, alpha-amyrin acetate, alpha-amyrin, lupeol acetate, and 3beta-hydroxy-24-nor-urs-4,12,28-triene.
